intro: Aeschynomene papulosa, commonly known as the hairy spurred orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spurred flowers that are often pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and typically have a hairy texture, contributing to its common name. Aeschynomene papulosa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and forest edges.
